ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I apologize, truly, for the harsh grading. The professor is a committed teacher. the problem is, the course is really incorrectly labeled. it is not a finance course for environmental managers- it is a financial course. there is ZERO VALUE to taking this course if you are interested in specific environment-related applications. it is straight finance. why not just label it as a 'crash course' in finance? why have any mention of environmental managers. very misleading- very disappointing. for instance, as a policy advocate, or a land manager, there is nothing in this course for you.

The class was great overal, but I would really prefer a full semester class, or maybe the class should betaught in the beginning of the semester. The end gets too crazy for me and most students. Adding an extra evening class is the last thing I have time for, but it's really my only choice.
Covered a lot of material in a short period, but provided a good conceptual grounding in financial and accounting concepts.

I was very excited to take this course. However, I was very disappointed by the end. Lectures were uninspired.I do greatly appreciate the instructor's effort to learn her student's names. I was impressed that she learned 50 names in 2 hours a week.

I had no experience in finance before this class, and this course was a perfect introduction. Dr. Burkedid an excellent job of explaining concepts in a way that was accessible to people with my level of experience. She was also very friendly and responsive to student questions and comments.
Excellent class. Great intro to Finance for Environmental Managers.
Instructor is more than excellent! Professor Burke has the confidence and knowledge necessary to teach such a complex issue in such short period of time.
The information available for this course is really helpful but the lectures are often difficult to sitthrough.
this course is great if you want to have a broad knowledge of accounting and finance terms. It has an adequate pace and the material is very valuable to save for future references.

3. The workload of this course was lighter than other courses, but that's what was expected since it'sa 1-credit course. The workload of a 1-credit course shouldn't be the same as for a 3-credit course.
The course covers a lot of material, therefore the pace is very fast to fully analyze the different topics.
Q4: There was a lot of content shoved into a small timeframe; I am gladI got the exposure but it waschallenging to soak in so much and so late at night.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: useful
Business insights. Well-structured material.

The lecture presentations and notes provided a solid foundation for financial work, and the homework was helpful in practicing some of the concepts. I think that one of the greatest benefits will be having these notes for reference in the future if my job calls for financial analysis on a project.
THe constancy with the examples used.
Very practical

The readings for each lecture are the best aspect of this course. So good in fact that the professor translates them to powerpoint slides and reads from the slides for 2 hours.You could do the reading and not need to go to lecture.
The material is super relevant and important to understand - not just professionally but also personally (understanding company valuation, stock valuation, etc).
The hw problems that used examples I might find in my future line of work (for example, having to calculate the IRR/payback of a wind energy project with tax incentives).
modeling the wind project under different policy regimes
The course materials were prepared very clearly and in-depth. Difficult to understand concepts were presented in an easy to understand way.
Examples in class

The whole course provided a nice package. I really liked the in-class exercises, because they gave us the chance to try the type of calculations we would need for the homework while Dr. Burke and Ran were there to answer questions. The homework was also extremely helpful. It was extensive enough to help us learn the concepts without piling on too much work at the end of the semester when everyone was already extremely busy.
The assignments were very helpful as learning exercises.
- Instructor, definitely!- Assignments were absolutely important to fix what we learned- Lectures' notes: a material for life
Professor is great.
The availability to bring a financial framework to management concepts
the study material and homework assignments
A lot of good, specific, and useful information.
Homework and in-class assignments
The concepts covered seem like they would be broadly useful in professional work and just being part of society.

It provides a general overview of the basic financial skills. Now I can understand the concepts and even though we only did a couple of assignments I feel comfortable to deal with this in a working environment.
Gives a great (though broad) overview of financial concepts, good exercises to reinforce understanding
We were given a lot of opportunities to use/figure out how to use the skills ourselves.
The material was new

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: We definitely need a text book, more examples were needed!
6-8pm in the evening is not a perfect time for lectures
completly rework the course description.
There is really a lot of content in each class. But this is not something that can be fixed easily, considering the amount of information that needs to be delivered and the duration of the course.
more interactive delivery
This course would have been better if it is a proper course with 3 credits. the class covers too much information within very short time.
I found it difficult to engage in a 2 hour lecture in the evening, although I'm not sure that this could be changed in the future due to scheduling conflicts.
The time, pace, move class to the beginning of the semester.
Maureen skipped too quickly through a few key concepts, perhaps assuming they were more clearly obvious than they were. Especially regarding the tax effects.
the pace is a little bit fast. it would be better if it's a 3 credit course that lasts for the whole semester

The presentation of material in class was not good. As stated above, the instructor reads from 70+ powerpoint slides each lecture. Really? I expect more from a Yale professor.I think maybe the course is ambitious in how much material it presents in a 6-week period. Either lengthen the course or cut some material.
So much material in such a short period of time!
Professor Burke moved very quickly through material and it was hard to grasp what she was talking about between the pace and the slide composition.
the time! it's hard to stay focused at night
Review - there could be more review of core concepts. We covered a lot of ground quickly. Full term course??
This course should be offered as a 3-credit, so the contents could be explained more thoroughly.
Nothing comes to mind.
Big class -- 45 students? Moved quickly, too fast for comprehension.
n/a
I can't think now in any suggestions - really well-taught course!
I think the course could be thought over the whole semester so students can spend more time on each topic

The instructor acknowledged it, but it really was a lot of material to cover in a 1-credit class! I feel like I have some familiarity with some of the concepts, but definitely don't feel like I grasped everything (even at an introductory level).During the in-class exercises, it was often hard to get the professor's attention, as she and the TA were often talking to each other, and not very attuned to students trying to get their attention to ask questions.
Instructor moved quickly, would sometimes state points from slide without explaining them
Some content might need to be cut out or an additional class period might be needed. It was too much content for the time allotted.

It should not be a 1 credit. 1 credits only work well when they are in the student normal field. For this course most people had to completely switch gears into a new way of thinking and then do the work. Its a valuable course it just cannot be done sufficiently with as little time as a 1 credit should take.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: good
N/A
n/a
It was effective, but extending class to a whole semester will help this point as well
N/A
N/A
N/A
N/A
straight forward, direct and good.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am very grateful that I can understand a lot of business terms after this class.
learned helpful practical tools

I do not have a strong background in financial accounting, and wanted to gain exposure through this course. This course met my expectations, and I feel more confident in my knowledge now (although I'm unclear at this point how it will directly apply to my career choices after graduation).
Really important skill to apply to my work in Agri-business
it's quite useful
Works well with a Business and Environment concentration.
Very helpful, as I intend to work in fields which use these tools frequently.
I study energy economics, and knowing how energy projects are financed is crucial to understanding why particular energy sources are or are not economical in specific situations.
Very important concepts and life skills.
I am interested in business and the environment, so this was very useful for me.
I'm heading to an MBA, and this course was perfect in providing me with the basic financial concepts and operations.
This course serves as a refresher on financial concepts. I plan to take accounting next year at SOM
This course helped me understand basic accounting and financial terms. It will be helpful to communicate with people in those fields in the future.

I just can imagine that these are concepts that would be useful to know if I'm working for non-profits or private companies in the future, or if I'm on the board of organizations like this. Also, my family has investments and stuff so this course kind of empowered me to feel like I know more about my money.
I will be able to analyze project investments in energy resources development.
Excellent for any environmental professional, as money is a driving force in every kind of organization
This course will give me a basic understanding of the assessments that both businesses and government entities complete when making financial decisions.
This is just good info to know.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to learn basic finance terms and be able to communicate using them.
gain basic financial analysis knowledge
i thought i'd learn about financial concepts for environmental management.
To learn the business vocabulary and try to have a different mindset.
part of requirement
See the answer to question 17.
Gain basic skills.
May need to financially assess food operations in future jobs
i thought it would be useful, as it is
Part personal fulfillment, part utility to my career.
I think that these concepts are very important to understand. I'm glad I took this class.
To learn more about financial concepts and project valuation.
Because I feel financial concepts are important for any sector. I want to go into the private sector.
I wanted to widen my knowledge base into finance, and I liked that the course was designed for total beginners.
I wanted an intro to finance.
See Question 17.
I wanted to begin building a financial framework of analysis
Learn about finance

Given how important money is for any organization/institution working on environmental issues (or any issues, really), I just thought this would be useful. And since it's only 1-credit, I assumed that the additional workload wouldn't be too intense.
I wanted to learn basic financial concepts.
Realized I needed to speak the finance language in order to make arguments for energy efficiency investments
I didn't have a sound understanding of finance.
My research uses ecosystem services which largely relies on financial terms, even though my research does not.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: yes
no
yes
basic financial concepts
Yes.
Yes, would have been nice to get some nonprofit accounting stuff too.
Yes and no, If I had more time to go deeper into the information presented I am sure I'd be able to gain valuable skills. But I didn't feel that I had time.
Yes.
yes
Yes.
Yes, but my learning was limited by the sheer amount of material we covered in a short amount of time. It provides a solid foundation for future learning, however.
Yes.
I need to review some of the concepts, but I thought that important concepts were all revealed to me.
Yes.
Yes!
Yes - this is an excellent intro to finance.

Yes - since the beginning, Professor Burke clarifies that the main goal of the course is to provide us with basic knowledge and make us feel confortable with financial terms. She was amazing is doing that!
yes, but i feel that a semester long class will have allow me to more in depth.
Yes

Kind of. I don't feel like I mastered anything, but there are a couple of concepts or vocabulary words that I feel like I have a better understanding of now. Based on feedback about the course from peers, I kind of knew going into it that it would be a lot of material to cover in a short amount of time/space. Still, I decided that the introduction would be useful.
Yes.
Yes, though the course is basic and did more to outline the things I wanted to learn more about than to teach me how to do them
I think I expected to know the skills better but I was exposed to much of what I wanted.
i have now heard the terms. I do not think I will retain much of the actual concepts.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: n/a
increase the efficiency of work

I was part of an informal study group, where we worked through problem sets on our own before discussing the answers and submitting final copies of the homework. I found these group sessions very helpful.
Really important in order to check your work and learn from others
Can understand how others see the problems. Disadvantages are that course work is often split up - some students don't go through problems themselves to any strong degree.
NA
I didn't work on homework as part of a group, but worked with my neighbors during in-class exercises. This helped us get past being stuck, and also helped to keep us focused on the task at-hand.
N/A

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Make sure you know someone who is good at Finance so they can help you!
make sure you know what youre getting yourself into, content wise. maureen is doing her best.
very good course to take.
good class to take if you have no financial related background

This course provides useful background knowledge on financial accounting, and would benefit students who lack prior experience. The instructor is responsive to student questions and has excellent insights from her professional experience prior to teaching.
Take it, it's the only option. Unless you want to take a full finance class at SOM, which I may now be considering.
get prepared! review the materials!
Don't take it. Get the readings from a friend or classesV2 and you will be just as well off, and you'll save yourself some time.
Take it and be prepared to be confused in class but figure out concepts through the HW.
Pay attention in class, review the class handouts. Have students stay off laptops when there is no specific classwork.
Take it.
I would definitely recommend taking this class if you are seeking a basic introduction to financial concepts.
If you always wanted to understand the basics of financing, even if you are not sure of its use in your professional life, this course is a must!
Use the homework as the most important learning experience in the class

This is a somewhat fast paced course. You need to find some time in your already busy end of semester schedule. It is however a good complement to your graduate studies because it teaches you how to communicate in business terms.
I recommend it
Just manage your expectations about how much you'll actually be able to grasp/cover during the course! And don't be shy about using office hours to understand the concepts -- they are indeed tricky.

The course succeeded in providing a foundation which you can build upon when you come across these concepts later in your career. It's definitely not long or detailed enough for you to learn too much. But it doesn't try to be. As long as you have your expectations straight, you'll get a lot out of it.
It is a very helpful course, even though it is very broad and only provides an overview of multiple topics.
Absolutely take this course as an intro, and if you like it, consider taking SOM courses to continue building skills
Keep up with the homeworks and go to the class. There's only so much you will understand if you don't go to the classes.
It will take more time to adjust to the concepts than you think. It is not hard, just different.
